video:video.video:title: Boeing, Boeing
video:video.video:description: Scenic design for Marc Camoletti's French farce about an American architect juggling three stewardess fiancées.

video:video.video:title: First Bank Lollipop Pop Up
video:video.video:description:
This experiential pop-up installation was developed in collaboration with Lumenati for FirstBank as part of a branded activation that later became a commercial campaign. The project centered around a playful, large-scale gesture: a fabricated oversized bowl filled with giant lollipops that guests could interact with and take away. While the concept was lighthearted, the execution required careful coordination between visual design, structural logic, and fabrication constraints.
My role focused on supporting the creative and fabrication teams through visualization and technical design. One of the primary challenges was determining how to aesthetically and structurally arrange a combination of real and fabricated lollipops within the bowl. The installation needed to feel abundant and intentional, while remaining durable, safe, and visually consistent from multiple viewing angles—including camera-facing perspectives for commercial photography.
I developed a series of renderings to explore scale, density, color balance, and placement, allowing the team to evaluate multiple approaches before fabrication began. These studies helped resolve questions around proportion and distribution, ensuring the lollipops read as a cohesive composition rather than competing individual objects. As the design progressed, I translated these studies into technical drawings that detailed the bowl geometry and internal disk system used to support and position the lollipops.
The technical documentation was used directly by the fabrication department, bridging the gap between concept and build. This process-driven approach allowed the team to move efficiently into fabrication with a clear understanding of both the visual intent and structural requirements. The final installation successfully delivered a bold, approachable visual experience that worked for public engagement and on-camera use. The project highlights my ability to collaborate across disciplines, using rendering and technical drafting as tools to support experiential design at scale.

video:video.video:title: Million Dollar Quartet
video:video.video:description: Discover the stunning co-scenic design for the 2025 production of Million Dollar Quartet, capturing the iconic recording session of Elvis Presley and his legendary peers.

video:video.video:title: Park & Shop
video:video.video:description: Discover the Park & Shop initiative, blending mid-century charm with modern design. Explore stunning concept renderings that celebrate heritage and innovation!

video:video.video:title: Themed Entertainment Design: Studio Ghibli-Inspired Immersive Dining Experience by Theatre Students
video:video.video:description: Studio Ghibli immersive dining takes center stage as theatre students explore themed entertainment design, merging storytelling with real-world creativity.

video:video.video:description: Explore how the 1960s revolutionized Hollywood musicals, blending rebellion and tradition, influencing today’s entertainment from Broadway to TikTok trends.

video:video.video:title: The Golden Age of Broadway: A Defining Era in Musical Theatre
video:video.video:description: Celebrating the legendary scenic designers who defined Broadway's Golden Age and their lasting influence.

video:video.video:title: The Coraline Experience: Twinmotion Walkthrough of the Other World
video:video.video:description: Explore the Other World in this Twinmotion walkthrough of The Coraline Experience, a collaborative MFA Design project at UC Irvine that brought together scenic, lighting, costume, sound, and stage management.

video:video.video:title: Vectorworks Quick Tips: Camera Tool and Rendering
video:video.video:description: Learn how to light, frame, and render your 3D model in Vectorworks using cameras and Renderworks styles. This quick tutorial covers spotlight setup, camera views, and exporting high-quality image files for presentations.

video:video.video:title: Vectorworks Quick Tip: Creating Custom Page Layouts
video:video.video:description: Learn how to set up a 24x36 sheet layer and export it to PDF in Vectorworks—without Adobe PDF or a plotter. Ideal for printing scenic drafting plates on standard systems.

video:video.video:title: Vectorworks Tutorial: Understanding Classes
video:video.video:description: Learn how to use classes in Vectorworks to organize scenic drawings, control visibility, and manage graphic attributes efficiently. This tutorial explains class structure, class-based attributes, and how grouping interacts with class visibility in real-world drafting workflows.

video:video.video:title: Footloose (2024) Scenic Design Walkthrough – Stephens College | Vectorworks + Twinmotion
video:video.video:description: Go behind the scenes of my 2024 scenic design for Footloose at Stephens College. Built in Vectorworks and rendered in Twinmotion, this walkthrough explores how movement and energy informed each design choice.

video:video.video:title: Vectorworks Tutorial: Understanding Design Layers
video:video.video:description: Learn how design layers help you organize scenic drawings in Vectorworks using a clear, drafting-based stacking system. This tutorial covers layer visibility, stacking order, consistent layer scales, and layer options like Gray/Snap Others to support clean theatrical drafting workflows.

video:video.video:title: Navigating the User Interface for Scenic Designers
video:video.video:description: Get familiar with the Vectorworks user interface and workspace setup for scenic design. This tutorial walks through templates, palettes, navigation tools, view controls, and coordinate systems so you can work confidently and efficiently from the start.

video:video.video:title: Vectorworks Tutorial: Basics Tool Palette
video:video.video:description: Learn how to use the Basic Tool palette in Vectorworks for efficient 2D drafting. This tutorial covers essential drawing, navigation, and modification tools used daily in scenic design workflows.

video:video.video:title: Vectorworks Tutorial: Sheet Layers
video:video.video:description: Learn how to use sheet layers in Vectorworks to lay out drawings for printing and presentation. This tutorial covers creating sheet layers, adding title blocks, generating viewports, and organizing a clean, readable drawing package.

video:video.video:title: Lysistrata (2021) Scenic Design – Outdoor Theatre During COVID
video:video.video:description: An outdoor production reimagined for a pandemic era—this scenic design for Lysistrata balanced ancient ritual with contemporary safety.

video:video.video:title: Creating 2D Drafting from a 3D Model
video:video.video:description: Learn how to turn a 3D Vectorworks model into clean, professional 2D drafting for scenic construction. This tutorial covers viewports, sections, rendering styles, and documentation techniques used in real-world production workflows.

video:video.video:title: Vectorworks Quick Tip: Creating Trim Profiles with the Polyline Tool
video:video.video:description: Learn how to use the Polyline tool to trace real-world trim profiles and turn them into clean, reusable 2D symbols for scenic drafting. This workflow covers importing reference images, refining curves with vertex modes, scaling to real dimensions, and saving profiles to your Resource Manager.

video:video.video:title: Vectorworks Tutorial: 2D Edit and Modify Tricks
video:video.video:description: This tutorial covers essential 2D edit and modify tools in Vectorworks, focusing on efficient drafting workflows for scenic design. You’ll learn how to mirror, reshape, offset, split, combine, align, scale, and duplicate geometry using both tools and Modify menu commands.
